message: Would you find an event that fires every hour on the hour useful? What if you could schedule events for (say) each Tuesday at 2:55 pm?
@rsbohn Yes sir!
Yes. That is on the roadmap, but it's not next.
But I would really love that.
I think I could run a free hourly chime service.
You can do this with Google Apps Script. I'm writing a blog post about it--more later.

Here's the post I wrote: http://wp.me/pUy1B-d6 I'm archiving TomatoFlix stats, which is a bit more complicated. But you can see how to set up a trigger to call a webhook endpoint at any time interval.
Hoo-ray!
So this allows Google Docs to pull from a Kynetx ruleset. You can use 'post to a spreadsheet' to push. Way cool!
Seems more targeted for 'recurrent' events as opposed to timekeeping. Perhaps that's good enough?
Depends what you need to do
It works great for my example of archiving stats
Sadly, the 'hourly' trigger will fire 60 minutes after you pull the pin. I guess you could fire every minute and then check the clock.
I was actually just thinking about that. You don't get a lot of control over when it actually fires unless you go every minute and check, like you say.
I have my sources. ;)
That's a good idea. Without the key the webhook is just ignored (or perhaps logged).
Indeed.

It might also be good to pass along some sort of key that is only in the apps script and your KRL app; that way I can't call your webhook to launch the missiles whenever I want; it'll only happen on your schedule.
hmm, select when webhook quotidian
or webhook roll_the_logs
Who told you about the missles?
eh, just kidding, right?
and easy: select when webhook launch_missles secret_knock "SpeakFriendAndEnter"
